title: Can we have an emergency button used per day instead of force leave?
body:
I know during in game you can't leave right away. But, when it is some sort emergency. There should be a button where you click and you just leave and let AI takeover. This will also tell players you have an emergency. Instead of getting first offence.

We can also have some sort of vote leave created by the player who is trying to leave for those who are actually playing against people they know or on tournament like style like clan wars. If you got to leave, you got to leave.

This system can only be used one time a day reset 24hr.

replies.body: By definition, an emergency is not something that should be occurring to you once a day.

1 time a day?

Holy cow if you have emergencys come up so often, stay out of my games.

emergency button.... i can see this being a good feature but as DEEP TERROR NAMI said 
>this wouldn't be used for emergencies 99.9% of the time


i agree but the pro and cons are really easy to see
pros: help ppl with possible emergencies and not get banned
The new AI system for intermediate is somewhat updated, i suggest is implemented, riot should spend some time developing something like dota (where the bots are stronger then the players) or something close to that
24hr every use, how bout every time it hits 0:00 your chances refresh

cons:could be abused by people having a bad game
there is trolls out there, if they get into a game and feed 10 kills, they can just "press the emergency button"

It may look lke a good idea for a lv12, but it would basically spell the end of the game for lv30 or ranked play. People ragequit enough as it is, removing penalties would make almost every game become a 4v5, then a 3v5, 2v5 as everyone bails out.

If people have "emergencies" that require them to log out without any warning this often, they should not be playing online games.

This wouldn't be used for emergencies 99.9% of the time, it'd just be a free leave. People do not need to leave games once a day; *maybe* once a month and you can save up a few if you don't use them? You probably don't want them replaced by AI, though, that's more detrimental to a team than them staying in base, because they steal your xp/gold and are unreliable and easy to kill.
